attributes.name: instanceId
attributes.description: Internal identifier of the cifsServer instance.

attributes.name: id
attributes.description: Unique identifier of the cifsServer instance.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: User-specified name for the SMB server.

attributes.name: netbiosName
attributes.description: Computer Name of the SMB server in Windows network.

attributes.name: domain
attributes.description: Domain name where SMB server is registered in Active Directory, if applicable.

attributes.name: lastUsedOrganizationalUnit
attributes.description: Last used organizational unit of the SMB server in Active Directory, if applicable.

attributes.name: workgroup
attributes.description: (Applies to stand-alone SMB servers.) Windows network workgroup for the SMB server.

attributes.name: isStandalone
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the SMB server is standalone. Values are:
  • true - SMB server is standalone.
  • false - SMB server is joined to the Active Directory.

attributes.name: health
attributes.description: Health information for the SMB server, as defined by the health resource type.

attributes.name: nasServer
attributes.description: NAS server that exposes file systems using the SMB server.

attributes.name: fileInterfaces
attributes.description: Interfaces that use the SMB protocol to serve the NAS server's file systems.

attributes.name: smbcaSupported
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the SMB server supports continuous availability. Values are:
  • true - SMB server supports continuous availability.
  • false - SMB server does not support continuous availability
    • .

attributes.name: smbMultiChannelSupported
attributes.description:
Indicates whether the SMB 3.0+ multichannel feature is supported. Values are:
  • true - SMB 3.0+ multichannel is supported.
  • false - SMB 3.0+ multichannel is not supported.

attributes.name: smbProtocolVersions
attributes.description: Supported SMB protocols, such as 1.0, 2.0, 2.1, 3.0, and so on.
